data.title: Excellent Music Wiki
data.text:
Avril Ramona Lavigne (born September 27, 1984) is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and actress. She started her career after winning a contest to perform with Shania Twain in 1999. She is considered to be the "Pop Punk Queen" and is credited with giving pop music more variety besides the dance-pop that was popular with artists like Britney Spears and Christina Aguilera. As of 2022, she has released seven albums.

Early life

Avril Ramona Lavigne was born in Belleville, Ontario, on September 27, 1984, to a mother of English, Scottish, and German descent and a French-Canadian father. Her parents recognized her vocal abilities when she sang "Jesus Loves Me" on the way home from church when she was 2.

Why She and Her Songs Rock

Many of her songs are very memorable, like "Girlfriend", and "Complicated".

She can play several different instruments.

She has some really good lyrics.

She has a great voice.

Her music videos are great, such as the aforementioned "Girlfriend" where it's not just herself, but she also has two alter egos in that video.

She is a good voice actress in the case of Over the Hedge.

She has great album covers, like the Under My Skin cover art, which is used for its dark tone cover art with a red cross on it.

She can mix genres together well.

She can give her songs a different tone.

Many people can associate "Girlfriend" with the old days of YouTube since it used to be the website's most viewed video at the time.

She has influenced several artists, including Aly & AJ, Busted, Billie Eilish, Hilary Duff, Rob Halford, Courage My Love, Ed Sheeran, Vanessa Hudgens, Jessie J, Jonas Brothers, Brie Larson, Lesley Roy, Ashley Tisdale, Ariana Grande, Paramore, Amy Studt, Meghan Trainor, Hey Monday, Kelly Osbourne, Amanda Palmer, Misono, YUI, Demi Lovato, Kirstin Maldonado, PVRIS, Soccer Mommy, Snail Mail, Liz Phair, Lil Uzi Vert, Princess Nokia, Lloyd Banks, the late Nipsey Hussle, John River, Bali Baby, Noname, Rico Nasty and Fat Tony.

When she was asked about being named the "Anti-Britney", she said she doesn't really hate Britney Spears and has more of a mixed opinion of her. She said it was very rude and mean.

She helped spawn the legendary meme known as "ear-rape" (although her song that did it was pretty bad).

She did a killer

Bad Qualities

She has some bad songs, like "Hello Kitty" and her cover of "Chop Suey!" by System of a Down. However, the latter can be credited for inspiring the "ear rape" meme.

On the topic of the former, the song received criticism for its racist depiction of Japanese culture.

While "Girlfriend" was positively received, it has a controversial message on how it's okay for a popular preppy girl to bully, harass and steal the boyfriend of a less popular and attractive girl. Her old goth/punk fanbase was not pleased with this.

She can be hypocritical, like when she claims to have written all of the songs on her debut album Let Go, when in reality, many professional songwriters co-wrote them with her.

Discography

Let Go (2002)

Under My Skin (2004)

The Best Damn Thing]] (2007)

Goodbye Lullaby (2011)

Avril Lavigne (2013)

Head Above Water (2019)

Love Sux (2022)

Trivia
